name: Greek Mythology, Part 4 Quiz | Greek Myth | 10 Questions

questions.text: Gaea created the sea after her creation of the sky, love, the mountains and the nymphs. What was the personification of the sea?
questions.explanation:
Pontus.

	Poseidon, Oceanus and Tethys were all sea-related beings...but not the sea itself, which was Pontus.

questions.text: Of the following, who was not an offspring of the union between the Titan, Crius, and Eurybia, daughter of Pontus and Gaea?
questions.explanation:
Clymene.

	Clymene was the daughter of Oceanus and Tethys.

questions.text: What tool, made from flint, was used by Cronus to castrate his father Uranus?
What race of women were the ash-nymphs?
Name any one of the Graeae.
What was the name of the three-bodied giant, son of Chrysaor, who was vanquished by Heracles?
Who were the 'young men' that made a war dance around the cave in which baby Zeus was kept hidden away from Cronus?
questions.explanation:
Curetes.

	And Zeus paid them back by slaying them after Hera had sent them after him...

questions.text: What goddess has a name which means 'prudence' or 'perfidy'?
The Cyclopes gave Zeus, Poseidon and Hades each magic weapons to use in war with the Titans. What weapon did Hades receive?
questions.explanation:
magic helmet.

	The helmet allowed him to become invisible.
